name: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2485
Reason: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components: (1) The basic unit for comparison is 1-methyl-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazole, which has a melting point of approximately 100 degrees Celsius. (2) The methyl group (–CH3) adds approximately +10 due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. (3) The two phenyl groups (–C(C)C) add approximately +20 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. (4) The trimethylphenyl group (–C(C)C(C)C) adds approximately +30 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
